title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support, reorganize paragraphs, and specify staff requirements for the Office of Environmental Education. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to specify staff requirements for the Office of Environmental Education, including a headquarters staff of 10 employees and support from regional offices. The Administrator may carry out activities through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to reduce the percentage of funding for environmental education grants. Additionally, grants under this section cannot be used for lobbying activities. SEC. 4 focuses on environmental internships and fellowships. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking sections 7 through 11 and redesignating them as sections 7 through 10. Conforming amendments include changes to the table of contents and section 4(b) of the Act. In amendments to the National Environmental Education Act, sections 7 through 11 are struck and redesignated as sections 7 through 10. Various amendments are made to specific sections by updating references to corresponding sections within the Act. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish the President's Environmental Youth Awards for students in grades K-12 who excel in promoting local environmental awareness. Additionally, an Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force are created. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish an Advisory Council with 11 members representing various sectors, and a Task Force with specified membership criteria. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to establish an Advisory Council with 11 members representing various sectors and a Task Force with open membership for federal agencies engaged in environmental education. The Advisory Council will hold biennial meetings on timely environmental education issues and provide recommendations. SEC. 7. NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOUNDATION. The name "National Environmental Education and Training Foundation" is changed to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in the National Environmental Education Act. Conforming amendments are made throughout the Act to reflect this name change. The National Environmental Education and Training Foundation is renamed to the Foundation for Environmental Education in the National Environmental Education Act, with corresponding amendments made throughout the Act. In the National Environmental Education Act, the Foundation for Environmental Education replaces the National Environmental Education and Training Foundation. Amendments include changing the number of directors from 13 to 19 and removing a condition of donations. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Funds are allocated for specific purposes with limitations on their use for environmental education activities. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for specific purposes, with limitations on fund usage for environmental education activities. This includes allocating funds for the Office of Environmental Education, with a breakdown of how the funds should be distributed among various programs and administrative expenses. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of the Act.
